resources.string: SmartContent are files protected by contextual information. With this app you can create and open such files. Contextual information can be information concerning the user\'s location (GPS), network (connected wifi) or also device specificities. You can also protect the file with a password.\n
Here\'s how to use the viewer \n
Main menu : \n
Create a new file or a draft by tapping on the "+" ("New Document") button in the action bar\n Open files by tapping on them and selecting "Open File", delete files by selecting "Delete File"\n
This is a protected SmartContent file\n
This is a draft of a SmartContent file\n
This is an unsupported file and can\'t be open with this software\n
Creating a file : \n
1) Write the name and content of the file in the appropriate fields\n 2) Click on the key icon ("Encoding file") to launch the encrypting procedure\n

Saving as draft will create a non-encrypted file that you can modify later on.\n Attention : draft files do NOT contain any contextual information or policy. To save those you must go through the full encoding procedure described below.\n
Encrypting a file : \n

In the encrypting window, you can select the different policies and contexts needed to protect your file with. \n The "Current Context" part shows you what contexts are currently available to use. Make sure you the different components needed are enabled (network, gps) if they don\'t appear.\n
Action : select what kind of action will be permitted on your file (note : in "Read and write", users will be able to modify policies!)\n
Password : enter a password that users will be prompted to enter\n
GPS Coordinates : select a range in which the file will be openable\n
Network connections : select network informations needed to open the file\n
Device informations : select informations from your device needed to open the file\n
Decoding a file : \n

When opening a SmartFile, the viewer asks the file what kind of contextual informations are needed to open it.\n If your current contextual informations correspond to the ones in which the file was encrypted with, you will be able to open the file.\n
Context retrieval might take some time. Make sure that all the necessary components are enabled (gps, network, wifi).\n

If your contextual information doesn\'t correspond to the one asked by the file, opening it will be cancelled. Please make sure you meet the necessary conditions to open this file. If not, contact the other of the specific file to learn them.\n
